title: Heavily pregnant Marnie Simpson laments she's overdue as she shares bump snap
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Pregnant Marnie Simpson bemoaned she was overdue.

It has hit the Geordie Shore star's due date and she is still waiting for her bundle of joy to arrive.

Often documenting her pregnancy journey with her 3.5million fans, she continued to keep her fans in the loop about her pregnancy.

In a glowing snap, Marnie posed in a pretty rose print bra and high-waisted pants in matching material.

The expectant mother placed a tender hand on her heavily pregnant stomach while she led on the bed.

Marnie showed off her natural beauty as she applied light make-up to her features.

(Image: Instagram)

She wrote alongside the bump snap: "Trust me to be over due. I was never gonna be early was I, I’m never early for anything.

She added: "Little man takes after his mamma and is fashionably late."

Marnie is so excited to finally become a family with boyfriend Casey Johnson.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

The happy couple are expecting a baby boy and she has even packed her hospital bag ready for the birth.

Casey appeared on X Factor in the boy band Stereo Kicks and he was also a member of Union J.

The pair reunited on MTV's Ex On The Beach and they have had an on/off relationship historically.

But they have gone from strength to strength since April when they announced their pregnancy news.

In recent months, Marnie has spoken about how pregnancy has left her feeling insecure about her body.

She wrote in a previous post: "Can't believe I'm almost there, pregnancy has been a experience. Watching my body change has been challenging to say the least.

"Not going to lie, I've started to develop some stretch marks and water retention leaving me with a hell more cellulite than usual which is daunting but I know it's going to be so worth it regardless when I see my baby boy."
description: Pregnant Marnie Simpson is waiting for her baby to arrive as she laments swiftly moving past her due date
